comment.author: 66406516@N08
comment._content: John L. Burns, a 70 year old veteran of the War of 1812, joined Union soldiers opposing the Confederate advance into Gettysburg on July 1, 1863. Wounded at least three times, he became a local celebrity and accompanied President Abraham Lincoln to church in November on the occasion of the dedication of the Gettysburg soldiers' cemetery. Up the lane in the extreme right of the photograph can be seen the photographer's wagon and portable darkroom tent.
